DOC.detailed_description: Cerebral malaria lethal complication P.falciparum infection mortality rate 5 40 % . Intravenous quinine remain recommended treatment cerebral malaria . However administration often feasible due lack simple equipment trained staff . When referral possible , viable alternative need . The intrarectal route interest child since painless simple . A study Francophone Africa report clinical efficacy tolerance intrarectal quinine . Although study randomize trial , blind use WHO definition cerebral malaria selection criterion . The current study aim establish whether intrarectal quinine effective safe intravenous quinine treatment childhood cerebral malaria . To address shortcoming Francophone African study , investigator design randomize , double blind placebo control clinical trial include patient meet WHO definition cerebral malaria . Hypothesis : Intrarectal quinine ( 15mg/kg every 8 hour ) give child cerebral malaria , lead short parasite clearance time ( 39.9 hour ) intravenous quinine ( 55.0 hour ) . The investigator calculate sample size 54 patient group 90 % power 95 % confidence . In calculation , researcher assume child receive intrarectal quinine would mean parasite clearance time 39.9 ( SD 24.3 ) hour receive intravenous quinine would mean parasite clearance time 55.0 ( SD 24.3 ) hour ( 27.5 % effect size ) , accord study Aceng , Byarugaba Tumwine hospital .
